Label: AL rdfs:label@en
Definition: AL IAO:0000115@en

Label: mechanical ecosystem management process
Definition: An active ecosystem management process during which a human employs machines or tools to directly impact an ecosystem and realize some ecosystem management goal.

Label: mechanical vegetation removal process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process during which vegetation is removed.

Label: root wrench removal process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process in which some human employs a tool comprising a lever and gripping portion (root wrench) to remove shrubs or small trees.

Label: cut and cover removal process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process during which plants at ground level are cut and residual stumps are covered with a sun-blocking material (e.g. silage tarp).

Label: cutting removal process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process in which some human cuts and removes plant material.

Label: spading removal process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process in which some human severs subsoil roots using a spade and pries the plant out of the ground.

Label: canopy thinning process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process in which some human removes trees from a given area with the goal of reducing overall canopy cover thereby increasing light availability for understorey plants.

Label: leaf litter removal process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process in which some human removes leaf litter from the ground thereby increasing the light availability for soil.

Label: mechanical fauna control process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human employs some mechanical means to control fauna.

Label: mammal trapping process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which some human uses traps to control fauna by containing and removing or killing them.

Label: predator control process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which some human targets predators for removal from the ecosystem by some mechanical means.

Label: fencing process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which some human installs fencing to restrict either immigration or emmigration of fauna from a particular area.

Label: mechanical species deterrent process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which some human installs a device to deter species from a particular area.

Label: mechanical hydrological alteration process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process during which the hydrologic cycle in an area is deliberately altered.

Label: dam construction process
Definition: A mechanical hydrological alteration process in which some human constructs some dam to restore a meander sequence to a river or stream.

Label: dam removal process
Definition: A mechanical hydrological alteration process in which some human removes some dam with the goal of altering the hydroperiod of surrounding lands and reconnecting rivers.

Label: tile drain crushing process
Definition: A mechanical hydrological alteration process in which some human uncovers and collapses subterranean tile drains in situ to reduce drainage on the landscape and restore wetland hydroperiod.
Comment: This technique is actively practiced by the Nature Conservancy of Canada, but has not been documented in the literature yet.

Label: tile drain removal process
Definition: A mechanical hydrological alteration process in which some human uncovers and removes subterranean tile drains to reduce drainage on the landscape and restore wetland hydroperiod.

Label: nest site creation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human creates nest sites for fauna.

Label: perch creation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human creates artificial perches for birds.

Label: buffer strip creation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human cultivates strips of flora between landscape features using earthworks and planting processes.

Label: riparian buffer strip creation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human cultivates strips of flora in the riparian areas of rivers.

Label: buffer strip retention process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human leaves strips of flora untouched when clearing the land for other purposes.

Label: earthworks process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process during which the topology of some area is deliberately changed.
Comment: Add comment here, describing issues with scale

Label: berm creation process
Definition: An earthworks process in which earthen barriers (berms) are constructed with the goal of obstructing or slowing floodwaters.

Label: pond creation process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human creates a pond by altering the topology of an area.

Label: pond reprofiling process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human reshapes the banks or basin of a pond using mechanical tools.

Label: soil decompaction process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human alleviates the compaction of soil to encourage flora productivity.

Label: tilling process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human breaks up the soil with a mechanical implement, and sometimes organic matter is added.

Label: ploughing process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human deeply breaks up and overturns soil and vegetation using a mechanical implement.

Label: grading process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human alters the topology of some land to create a specific slope.

Label: slope stabilization process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human installs inorganic material, usually a mesh, to stabilize a slope.

Label: shoreline reinforcement process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human installs inorganic material, usually in a mesh, to stabilize a slope on the bank of a body of water.

Label: pit and mound excavation process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human digs pits and mounds to recreate a natural disturbance regime.

Label: channel realignment process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human realigns the channel of a stream by digging out replacement pathways and filling existing ones.

Label: natural channel realignment process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human realigns the channel of a stream by digging out replacement pathways and filling existing ones with the goal of recreating a natural pool-riffle-pool meander sequence.

Label: dredging process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human removes the sediment layer of a water body.

Label: fauna passage creation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human creates a crossing (bridge or underpass) to help fauna pass through a barrier such as a road, fence or property.

Label: topsoil removal process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human removes the topsoil layer.

Label: erosion control process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human installs some material to reduce erosion.

Label: erosion blanket process
Definition: An erosion control process in which some human installs a textile to prevent erosion.

Label: erosion fencing process
Definition: An erosion control process in which some human installs a fence with a geotextile to restrict sediment transport.

Label: wattle fencing process
Definition: An erosion control process in which some human interleaves live materials to make short fencing along a slope and prevent erosion.

Label: irrigation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human installs semi-permanent lines to supply a controlled amount of water to plants.

Label: deterrence-focused predator control process
Definition: A predator control process in which some human installs a mechanical device designed to deter predators from a given area.

Label: fauna exclusion process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which some human uses mechanical means to exclude fauna from a specific area.

Label: mechanical fauna deterrent process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which some human uses mechanical means to deter fauna from a specific area.

Label: fauna capture for conservation
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which some human captures fauna for the purposes of protecting existing organisms from some threat.

Label: fish bypass installation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human installs some means of bypassing hazards (e.g. dams) for fish.

Label: fish ladder installation process
Definition: A fish bypass installation process in which some human installs a chute consisting of a series of stepped pools to allow fish to move past a dam.

Label: ditch plugging process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human fills in a drainage ditch to restore the hydroperiod to a given area.

Label: sediment addition process
Definition: An earthworks process in which some human adds sediment to a water body in order to modify the substrate composition.

Label: new plant protection process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which some human installs a barrier to protect newly planted flora from herbivory.
